meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or rights
meanings.sent1: She was devested of her belongings after the fire.
meanings.sent2: The court devested him of his parental rights.
meanings.sent3: The magician devested the volunteer of all her coins, leaving her amazed.
meanings.sent4: The storm devested the trees of their leaves overnight.
meanings.sent5: The thief devested the museum of its most valuable artifacts in a daring heist.

meanings.sent1: The teacher devested distractions from the classroom to help students focus.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner devested the room of all dust and dirt.
meanings.sent3: The chef devested the dish of all unnecessary ingredients, leaving only the essentials.
meanings.sent4: The wind devested the garden of its colorful petals, scattering them everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The detective devested the crime scene of all evidence, leaving no trace behind.

meanings.sent1: The new law devested citizens of their privacy rights.
meanings.sent2: The dictator devested the people of their freedom.
meanings.sent3: The prankster devested the office of all pens, causing chaos during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The illness devested him of his strength, leaving him bedridden.
meanings.sent5: The economic crisis devested the country of its wealth, leading to widespread poverty.
